title: How to Create an Apple Doll

steps.headline: Take a medium-sized apple, and peel it.
steps.description: Crisp apples such as Granny Smith or Gala Empire are best but soft ones work fine.

steps.headline: Take a small knife, it can be plastic or real, and form a nose, eyebrows, mouth and eyes.
steps.description: Optional - add some little cuts and dents all over the 'flesh' of the doll.

steps.headline: Once the apple looks like the face you intended, stop.
Soak the apple in the lemon juice for half an hour.
Get it started drying in a 100 ^F oven for an hour or two.
steps.description: Put parchment paper under the apple, and turning it a few times, will help prevent a soppy underside.

steps.headline: Leave the apple to dry out for several days.
steps.description: It will be drier than wet to touch, and rubbery to pressure. Once it is dried out enough, it should look like the face of an old woman.

steps.headline: Create a body out of a rag.
steps.description: Drive a skewer up through the stem axis and introduce a doubled-over pipe cleaner or small dowel to support the apple's weight.

steps.headline: Add limbs (twisted pipe cleaners), hair, clothing, and accessories such as a hat, broomstick, tiny iPod, etc.

tyn: (optional) rag to make a body, newspaper to put it on
text: Take a medium-sized apple, and peel it. Crisp apples such as Granny Smith or Gala Empire are best but soft ones work fine. Take a small knife, it can be plastic or real, and form a nose, eyebrows, mouth and eyes. Optional - add some little cuts and dents all over the 'flesh' of the doll. Once the apple looks like the face you intended, stop.  Dissolve 15cc (1 Tbsp.) salt in 300ml lemon juice (~1 cup) Soak the apple in the lemon juice for half an hour.  Get it started drying in a 100 ^F oven for an hour or two. Put parchment paper under the apple, and turning it a few times, will help prevent a soppy underside. Leave the apple to dry out for several days. It will be drier than wet to touch, and rubbery to pressure. Once it is dried out enough, it should look like the face of an old woman. Create a body out of a rag. Drive a skewer up through the stem axis and introduce a doubled-over pipe cleaner or small dowel to support the apple's weight. Add limbs (twisted pipe cleaners), hair, clothing, and accessories such as a hat, broomstick, tiny iPod, etc.  Voila! You've made an apple doll!
